definitions.text: (baseball) an advance to first base by a batter who receives four balls
examples: he worked the pitcher for a base on balls

definitions.text: (military) a written leave of absence
examples: he had a pass for three days

definitions.text: (American football) a play that involves one player throwing the ball to a teammate
examples: the coach sent in a passing play on third and long

definitions.text: the location in a range of mountains of a geological formation that is lower than the surrounding peaks
examples: we got through the pass before it started to snow

definitions.text: any authorization to pass or go somewhere
examples: the pass to visit had a strict time limit

definitions.text: a document indicating permission to do something without restrictions
examples: the media representatives had special passes

definitions.text: a flight or run by an aircraft over a target
examples: the plane turned to make a second pass

definitions.text: a bad or difficult situation or state of affairs
a difficult juncture
examples: a pretty pass
matters came to a head yesterday

definitions.text: one complete cycle of operations (as by a computer)
examples: it was not possible to complete the computation in a single pass

definitions.text: you advance to the next round in a tournament without playing an opponent
examples: he had a bye in the first round

definitions.text: a permit to enter or leave a military installation
examples: he had to show his pass in order to get out

definitions.text: a complimentary ticket
examples: the star got passes for his family

definitions.text: a usually brief attempt
examples: he took a crack at it
I gave it a whirl

definitions.text: (sports) the act of throwing the ball to another member of your team
examples: the pass was fumbled

definitions.text: success in satisfying a test or requirement
examples: his future depended on his passing that test
he got a pass in introductory chemistry

definitions.text: (ballet) a step in dancing (especially in classical ballet)
go across or through
examples: We passed the point where the police car had parked
A terrible thought went through his mind

definitions.text: move past
examples: A black limousine passed by when she looked out the window
He passed his professor in the hall
One line of soldiers surpassed the other

definitions.text: make laws, bills, etc. or bring into effect by legislation
examples: They passed the amendment
We cannot legislate how people spend their free time

definitions.text: pass by
examples: three years elapsed

definitions.text: place into the hands or custody of
examples: hand me the spoon, please
Turn the files over to me, please
He turned over the prisoner to his lawyers

definitions.text: stretch out over a distance, space, time, or scope; run or extend between two points or beyond a certain point
examples: Service runs all the way to Cranbury
His knowledge doesn't go very far
My memory extends back to my fourth year of life
The facts extend beyond a consideration of her personal assets

definitions.text: travel past
examples: The sports car passed all the trucks

definitions.text: come to pass
examples: What is happening?
The meeting took place off without an incidence
Nothing occurred that seemed important

definitions.text: go unchallenged; be approved
examples: The bill cleared the House

definitions.text: pass time in a specific way
examples: how are you spending your summer vacation?

definitions.text: pass over, across, or through
examples: He ran his eyes over her body
She ran her fingers along the carved figurine
He drew her hair through his fingers

definitions.text: transmit information
examples: Please communicate this message to all employees
pass along the good news

definitions.text: disappear gradually
examples: The pain eventually passed off

definitions.text: go successfully through a test or a selection process
examples: She passed the new Jersey Bar Exam and can practice law now

definitions.text: be superior or better than some standard
examples: She exceeded our expectations
She topped her performance of last year

definitions.text: accept or judge as acceptable
examples: The teacher passed the student although he was weak

definitions.text: allow to go without comment or censure
examples: the insult passed as if unnoticed

definitions.text: transfer to another; of rights or property
examples: Our house passed under his official control

definitions.text: pass into a specified state or condition
examples: He sank into nirvana

definitions.text: throw (a ball) to another player
examples: Smith passed

definitions.text: be inherited by
examples: The estate fell to my sister
The land returned to the family
The estate devolved to an heir that everybody had assumed to be dead

definitions.text: cause to pass
examples: She passed around the plates

definitions.text: grant authorization or clearance for
examples: Clear the manuscript for publication
The rock star never authorized this slanderous biography

definitions.text: pass from physical life and lose all bodily attributes and functions necessary to sustain life
examples: She died from cancer
The children perished in the fire
The patient went peacefully
The old guy kicked the bucket at the age of 102

definitions.text: eliminate from the body
examples: Pass a kidney stone

definitions.text: of advancing the ball by throwing it
examples: a team with a good passing attack
a pass play
